description: Like the 'ee' in 'cheese'. A long, tense smile.
Like the 'i' in 'ship'. A short, relaxed sound.
Like the 'e' in 'bed'. Mouth mid-open, tongue at the front.
Like the 'a' in 'cat'. Mouth wide, jaw dropped, tongue low and forward.
Like the 'ar' in 'car'. A long, open sound, like at the dentist.
Like the 'o' in 'dog'. A short sound with rounded lips and an open jaw.
Like the 'oor' in 'door'. A long sound with rounded lips.
Like the 'oo' in 'book'. A short sound with rounded lips.
Like the 'oo' in 'goose'. A long sound with tightly rounded lips.
Like the 'u' in 'cup'. A short, open sound, like being punched in the gut.
Like the 'ur' in 'bird'. A long, flat, neutral sound.
The 'a' in 'sofa'. A very short, relaxed, unstressed sound. The most common vowel in English.
Like the 'ay' in 'train'. Starts with 'e' (bed) and glides to 'i' (ship).
Like the 'i' in 'bike'. Starts open 'a' (cat) and glides to 'i' (ship).
Like the 'oy' in 'boy'. Starts with 'aw' (door) and glides to 'i' (ship).
Like the 'o' in 'boat'. Starts neutral 'uh' (sofa) and glides to 'oo' (book).
Like the 'ow' in 'house'. Starts open 'a' (cat) and glides to 'oo' (book).
Like the 'ear' in 'beer'. Starts with 'i' (ship) and glides to neutral 'uh' (sofa).
Like the 'air' in 'chair'. Starts with 'e' (bed) and glides to neutral 'uh' (sofa).
Like the 'our' in 'tour'. Starts with 'oo' (book) and glides to neutral 'uh' (sofa). (Becoming rare, often replaced by /ɔː/)
A puff of air from the lips, no voice. Like 'p' in 'park'.
A voiced sound from the lips. Like 'b' in 'bed'. Feel your throat vibrate.
A sharp tap of the tongue tip behind the top teeth, no voice. Like 't' in 'tea'.
A voiced tap of the tongue tip behind the top teeth. Like 'd' in 'door'.
A hard sound from the back of the tongue, no voice. Like 'c' in 'key'.
A voiced, hard sound from the back of the tongue. Like 'g' in 'gate'.
Top teeth on bottom lip, blow air, no voice. Like 'f' in 'face'.
Top teeth on bottom lip, make a buzzing sound. Like 'v' in 'van'.
Tongue tip between teeth, blow air, no voice. Like 'th' in 'thumb'.
Tongue tip between teeth, make a buzzing sound. Like 'th' in 'feather'.
A hissing sound with the tongue tip near the roof of the mouth, no voice. Like 's' in 'snake'.
A buzzing sound with the tongue tip near the roof of the mouth. Like 'z' in 'zoo'.
A 'shushing' sound, lips slightly rounded, no voice. Like 'sh' in 'shoe'.
A voiced 'sh' sound, like the 's' in 'treasure' or 'television'.
A gentle puff of air from an open mouth. Like 'h' in 'hat'.
A humming sound with lips closed, air through the nose. Like 'm' in 'man'.
Tongue tip on the roof of the mouth, air through the nose. Like 'n' in 'nose'.
A nasal sound from the back of the tongue, like the 'ng' in 'king'.
Tongue tip on the roof of the mouth, air flows around the sides. Like 'l' in 'leg'.
Tongue tip curled back but not touching, voiced. Like 'r' in 'red'. (RP is non-rhotic, so 'r' is only pronounced before a vowel).
A gliding sound, starts like 'ee' but moves. Like 'y' in 'yacht'.
A gliding sound with rounded lips. Like 'w' in 'web'.
A combination of 't' and 'sh'. Like 'ch' in 'church'.
A combination of 'd' and the 'zh' sound from 'vision'. Like 'j' in 'jam'.
